attributes.action: If A Dangerous Dog Kills Another Dog They Should Be Destroyed
attributes.additional_details: My Molly Was a 15 Week old Jackapoo Puppy That Was An Absolute Joy To Be Around, We Took Her For A Walk At Frensham Little Pond On 21/07/18 And She Was Attacked By A Dog That Got Un-muzzled. Molly Was Brutally Killed By This Dog She Didn't Even Stand A Chance. There Is Currently No Law Where If A Dog Kills Another Dog That It Should Be Destroyed. We Want To Have This Law Changed NOW. The Owner Should Take Full Responsibility And Have The Dog Destroyed Anyway.
attributes.background: So I Want To Change The Dangerous Dog Act Because I Think If A Dog Kills Another Dog That It Should Be Put Down.

rejection.details:
It's already against the law for someone to allow a dog to be out of control in a public place. This could include allowing their dog to attack another animal. You can find out more about this here:

https://www.gov.uk/control-dog-public

The owner can get an unlimited fine or be sent to prison for up to 6 months (or both) if their dog is dangerously out of control. They may not be allowed to own a dog in the future and their dog may be destroyed.

You can find out how to report a dog here:

https://www.gov.uk/control-dog-public/report-a-dog

We're therefore not sure what additional action you'd like the Government or Parliament to take.
